questionText: What is the switch statement used for in C?
options: For handling multiple choices based on a variable's value

questionText: Which data types can be used in a switch expression?
What happens if you forget the break statement in a case?
options: The program will terminate with an error
Execution will fall through to the next case
Only the default case will be executed

questionText: When is the default block in a switch executed?
options: When a break statement is encountered
After all cases have been executed
When none of the case values match the expression

questionText: Can you use value ranges in a case label in C?
options: No, only discrete values are allowed

questionText: Which of the following statements about switch are true? (Choose all that apply)
options: break is used to exit the switch statement
A case label must end with a colon
Multiple values can be listed in a single case using commas
correctAnswers: break is used to exit the switch statement
A case label must end with a colon

questionText: What is an advantage of using a switch statement over a chain of if-else statements for multiple choices?
options: Code with switch is more readable and structured

questionText: Why is it important to use break in each case?
options: To prevent unintended fall-through to subsequent cases
To make the program run faster
break is mandatory in the C language
